dt: {bc}to make slow or {a_link|slower} {bc}slacken the speed of

pt: {sc}delay{/sc} {sc}retard{/sc} {sc}slow{/sc} {sc}slacken{/sc} {sc}detain{/sc} mean to cause to be late or behind in movement or progress. {sc}delay{/sc} implies a holding back, usually by interference, from completion or arrival.
{sc}retard{/sc} suggests reduction of speed without actual stopping.
{sc}slow{/sc} and {sc}slacken{/sc} also imply a reduction of speed, {sc}slow{/sc} often suggesting deliberate intention
, {sc}slacken{/sc} an easing up or relaxing of power or effort.

pt.t: on hot days runners {it}slacken{/it} their pace

pt: {sc}detain{/sc} implies a holding back beyond a reasonable or appointed time.

shortdef: to make slow or slower : slacken the speed of —often used with down or up
